DOC.criteria: Patient ≥ 18 year age . The target de novo restenotic Percutaneous Transluminal Angioplasty ( PTA ) lesion ( ) is/are locate common femoral , superficial femoral popliteal artery . The reference vessel lumen ( proximal target lesion ) ≥ 4.0mm . Evidence ≥ 70 % stenosis occlusion confirm angiography . Guidewire must cross lesion ( ) within true lumen , without subintimal course patient consider enter study . Patient acceptable candidate percutaneous intervention use Jetstream NAVITUS System accordance label indication instruction use . Lesion length ≥ 4cm . Patient Rutherford category score 13 . Patient sign approve informed consent . Patient willing comply followup evaluation specify time . Patient uncontrollable allergy nitinol , stainless steel stent material contrast agent . Patient unable take appropriate antiplatelet therapy . Patient patent distal runoff vessel . Patient critical limb ischemia ( i.e. , Rutherford class 46 ) Limited vascular access precludes safe advancement Jetstream NAVITUS System target lesion ( ) . Interventional treatment intend instent restenosis . Patient target vessel moderate severe angulation ( e.g. , > 30 degree ) tortuosity treatment segment . Patient history coagulopathy hypercoagulable bleeding disorder . Patient receive hemodialysis significantly impair renal function ( creatinine > 2.5 mg/dl ) time treatment . Patient evidence intracranial gastrointestinal bleeding within past 3 month . Patient severe trauma , fracture , major surgery biopsy parenchymal organ within past 14 day . Patient surgical endovascular procedure vascular territory within 30 day prior index procedure . Patient plan surgical intervention endovascular procedure within 30 day index procedure . Use another debulking device index procedure prior Jetstream NAVITUS System exclude patient .
